tasks.task: Admitting a vehicle to a farm or ranch for livestock transport
subtasks: Responding to the farm's secure entry point instructions
Providing necessary contact information upon entry
Allowing farm staff to inspect the vehicle
Cleaning the vehicle if it is dirty or contaminated
Signing a log upon entry and exit
Receiving guidance on vehicle routing within the premises
Being shown the loading area and instructions
Reviewing required paperwork such as CVI, brand inspection certificate, bill of lading, and bill of sale
Ensuring footwear and coveralls are clean
Verifying clean outs and bedding on trailers
Examining animals during loading and rejecting sick or injured ones
Confirming the number and classes of animals loaded
Locking all gates after loading

tasks.task: Handling animal transport procedures at the destination farm
subtasks: Gaining admittance to the premises for animal unloading
Following designated routes within the premises
Signing in at the facility if required
Examining transported animals' paperwork upon unloading
Verifying numbers and classes of animals unloaded
Identifying and segregating sick animals
Cleaning the transportation equipment after unloading

tasks.task: Admission procedures and vehicle preparation at farm entry
subtasks: Inspect vehicle for dirt/contamination and clean if necessary
Verify required paperwork (such as CVI, brand inspection, bills)
Put on clean footwear and coveralls
Check trailers are clean and confirm bedding is fresh
Examine animals for health (look for signs of sickness; possible tasks like checking temperature, but the transcript says "for signs of illness," so maybe this is task-appropriate)
Verify paperwork upon arrival/loading
Inspect animals and segregate sick ones
Count and confirm numbers of animals loaded/unloaded
Ensure gates are securely closed after loading/unloading
Clean vehicles/equipment using cleaning facilities or on-site (might involve water, brushes, etc.)
Perform thorough clean-out when back at home base (same as above)
Inspect vehicle for dirt and perform necessary cleaning
Check in with the farmer and verify necessary paperwork
Put on sanitized coveralls and footwear
Confirm previous clean-outs on trailers and ensure bedding is fresh
Inspect animals for signs of illness and separate them if found
Count and verify the number and classes of animals being loaded
Close all gates securely after loading
Inspect required paperwork upon arrival/卸货
Count and verify the number and classes of animals being unloaded
Separate any sick animals immediately
Clean transportation equipment at the facility's cleaning area or as directed
Perform thorough clean-out and disinfection when bringing equipment home

tasks.task: Admitting a vehicle to a farm for livestock transport

subtasks: ** Check if the vehicle is dirty or contaminated and perform necessary cleaning if required (SUBTASK).
** Sign in, follow designated entry routes, and have vehicles inspected by farm staff (SUBTASKS).
** Verify previous clean-outs to ensure trailers are free of manure or dirt (SUBTASK).
** Confirm that fresh, unused bedding is present on trailers (SUBTASK).
** Wear sanitized coveralls and footwear provided by the farm (SUBTASK).
** Check for signs of illness or injury and reject any sick or injured animals (SUBTASK).
** Examine required documents such as CVI, brand inspection certificates, bills of lading, and bills of sale (SUBTASK).
** Accurately count the number and classes of animals being loaded (SUBTASK).
** Ensure all gates are closed and securely fastened after loading (SUBTASK).
** Check animal identification and documentation upon arrival at the destination (SUBTASK).
** Re-evaluate animals for any signs of health issues and separate them promptly (SUBTASK).
** Confirm the number and classes of animals unloaded from the transport (SUBTASK).
** Direct the transport vehicle to designated cleaning facilities for thorough sanitization (SUBTASK).
** Thoroughly clean the vehicle and equipment, removing manure and pathogens (SUBTASKS).
